'''Douglas Clark Kenney''' ([[10 December|December 10]], [[1947]]- [[29 August|August 29]], [[1980]]) was the co-author of ''[[Bored of the Rings (book)|Bored of the Rings]]'' along with longtime collaborator Henry Beard. He was a creative mastermind at, and a co-founder of ''National Lampoon''. He wrote for the magazine, the radio program, the stage productions, comedy albums and the TV special ''Lemmings: Dead in Concert'' as well as the first film ''Animal House''. He died falling off a cliff in Hawaii at the age of 33.
